title: What do I study after Bsc - Psychology? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can pursue a master's degree in psychology and after that you can go for research work(phd).If you don't wish to go for pg course of two years then you can even do diploma in counselling, psychotherapy,psycho-oncology etc. You can even try for MBA after bsc in psychology. You can specialize in hrd or marketing as per your interest.You can even go for special education and help mentally challenged children. All the best :)

It depends on what career you want. A psychology undergraduate degree is a good background for many lines of work including sales, human resources, teaching, research, and therapist some of which (in the US) you can enter with only the Bsc degree and some of which require additional graduate study. Career requirements differ from country to country. My recommendation is first to decide on how you want to earn your living, then arrange what in the US are called informational interviews with several people who have been successful in the work that you want to pursue, and finally — if your preferred profession requires a license — check with your own government licensing authorities to find out the exact license requirements. Good luck!
